reasoning: MFH (now called undifferentiated pleomorphic sarcoma) was historically the most common adult STS subtype at ~10-15% of cases. Approximately 0.45 per 100k based on SEER data.
source: Fletcher CDM (2006). The evolution of the classification of soft tissue tumours - an update based on the new WHO classification. Histopathology. 48(1):3-12
